chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chauncey G Weller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Chauncey G Weller.  Attorney Monica J. Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Weller

As to Count #4 of Case 20CF47: The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision, concurrent. 
140 days credit 

As to Count #5 of Case 20CF263: The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision, concurrent. 
140 days credit

As to Count #2 of Case 21CF378: The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision, concurrent.  
140 days credit

As to Count #1 of Case 21CF379: The Court sentences the Defendant to 30 days jail, concurrent.

As to Count #2 of Case 21CF379: The Court sentences the Defendant to  4  years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent. 
140 days credit

As to Count #1 of Case 21CF428: The Court sentences the Defendant to  4  years Imprisonment, consisting of 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent. 
149 days credit

As to Count #2 of Case 21CF428: The Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, concurrent. 

As to Count #3 of Case 21CF428: The Court sentences the Defendant to 30 days jail, concurrent. 

As to Count #4 of Case 21CF428: The Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, concurrent. 

As to Count #5 of Case 21CF428: The Court sentences the Defendant to 30 days jail, concurrent. 


As to Count #1 of Case 21CF435:
--To serve  30 days  jail, with Huber, concurrent
--Days credit for time already served: 149 days
--To pay fine of $350+ costs
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

As to Count #3 of Case 21CF435: The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision, concurrent.  


As to Count #4 of Case 21CF435: The Court sentences Defendant to 30 days jail, concurrent. 

As to Count #5 of Case 21CF435: The Court sentences the Defendant to  3  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision, concurrent.  

As to Count #1 of Case 21CF634: The Court sentences the Defendant to 45 days jail, concurrent.
140 days credit

As to Count #1 of Case 22CF51: The Court sentences the Defendant to 6 months jail, concurrent.
140 days credit

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license and Agent approval
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

The Court orders all costs/fees/surcharges to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

The Court denies expungement; gives basis. 

The Court finds Defendant eligible for CIP/SAP
recess: 12:00pm
Court's Response to Defendant's 6/29/22 Letter: At this point, bond is revoked. I would nee the consent of the State to even consider such a request.
Letter from defendant request furlough
Sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Cases 20CF47, 20CF263, 21CF378, 21CF379, 21CF380, 21CF407, 21CF428, 21CF435, 21CF634, 21CT532, and 22CF51 called at 2:46pm 
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights are reviewed; 
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered to Count #4 of Case 20CF47
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered to Count #5 of Case 20CF263
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered to Count #2 of Case 21CF378
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered to Counts #1 and #2 of Case 21CF379
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered to Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, and #5 of Case 21CF428
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered to Counts #1, #3, #4, and #5 of Case 21CF435
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered to Count #1 of Case 21CF634
Plea of " NO CONTEST " entered to Count #1 of Case 22CF51

Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismsses: Remaining Counts/Cases

Atty De La Rosa requests sentencing be set out 21 days.

ADA Shock moves to revoke bond/bail
The Court revokes bond.

recess: 3:12am 
NEXT: Sentencing on 7/29/22 at 11:00am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 20CF47, 20CF263, 21CF378, 21CF379, 21CF380, 21CF407, 21CF428, 21CF435, 21CF634, 21CT532, and 22CF51 called at 9:08AM
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO FILES 21CF634 AND 22CF51:

Files 21CF634 and 22CF51 are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings, however the Defense files waiver documents prior to the case being called.

The Court proceeds with Waivers of Preliminary Hearings in these files:

The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignments:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited as to both files
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all Counts in each file
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial

-----------------------------------------------

The Defense advises that resolution has been more or less reached, and requests that Plea and Sentencing be scheduled approximately 60 days out.
The State does not object, but requests that Jury Trial dates be scheduled in file 20CF47, citing the age of the case.

recess 9:19AM

In all files: 
(1) Plea and Sentencing 06/13 at 2:30PM (JA - Block off an hour for this hearing)
In file 20CF47:
(2) Final Status Conference on 07/12 at 10:30AM with in person appearances (all other files to track along for Status)
(3) Jury Trial on 07/18 at 8:30AM
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Chauncey G Weller

Prior: W5370 Urban Dr Lot 20, Johnson Creek, WI 53038 United States

[ml] Cases 20CF47, 20CF263, 21CF378, 21CF379, 21CF380, 21CF407, 21CF428, 21CF435, 21CF634, 21CT532, and 22CF51 called at 1:37PM
Defendant Chauncey G Weller appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

As to file 22CF51:

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

As to the matter of Bond:

The Court does not forfeit the current bonds set in all files, and removes the Bail Bond Forfeiture Hearings from its calendar.
The Court modifies bond in all files except 22CF51 to require $5,000.00 Cash Bond in each file with the same conditions as previously ordered.

In file 22CF51, the Court requires a $750.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

recess 1:53PM

NEXT: 
(1) In files 21CF634 and 22CF51: Preliminary Hearing on 04/05 at 9:00AM with in person appearances (all other files to track along for Status)
(2) Clerk - Please remove Mr. Weller's BBF Hearings from the Court's calendar
Extradition Forecast
Upon arrest, Defendant to be brought before Branch III ONLY

[ma] Cases 20CF47, 20CF263, 21CF378, 21CF379, 21CF380,21CF407,21CF428, 21CF435, 21CF634, 21CT532, 22CF51 called at 9:42 AM 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy is present for scheduled Preliminary Hearing in Case 21CF634.
Defendant Chauncey G Weller does NOT appear. 

The Court reviews court records.

Atty De La Rosa has no information as to the non-appearance of Mr. Weller. 

ADA Teuber requests warrants and bonds be found in default. 

The Court authorizes body only bench warrants in each case, upon arrest Mr. Weller is to be brought before Branch III ONLY
The Court finds probable cause to exist in Case 22CF51.

The Court finds all bonds on file in default.
